Explore our subjects and qualifications

  • University life

    Get to know what life is like at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. See what our students say and check out our campuses and support services.

  • Programmes and courses

    We offer a range of programmes for anyone looking to study at university for the first time, further their studies and career, or retrain in a new profession.

  • Planning your studies

    We can help you make the right decisions now to get where you want to go in your career and your life.

  • Apply to enrol

    To study at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington you need to gain admission and then apply to enrol.

  • Financing your study

    Work out the cost of your study and how you will pay for it—check if you can get fees-free study, student loans and allowances, and search for scholarships.

  • Events, visits, and Open Day

    Our events offer you the chance to talk to staff and students. Visit us on campus, attend an information evening, or join us at an online session.

Steps to apply

Follow these steps to help you apply and prepare for study.

Are you an international student? See your how to apply steps

Contact us if you need help. Or come to one of our events.

Apply to study checklist

Follow these steps to help you apply and prepare for study.

Are you an international student? See your how to apply steps

Sign up to save your progress or load your previous progress.

Welcome, .

Is this you?

Choose a programme

Check you meet the entry requirements and prerequisites of your chosen programme.

Check your admission type

You need to meet one of the admission types to gain entry to the University.

Plan your courses

Select the courses you need to take in your first year for your programme. Get course advice if you need help.

Apply for scholarships

Search our database—scholarships are available at all levels of study and based on a variety of criteria.

Find accommodation

Apply for our halls of residence or find private rental accommodation.

Apply to study

Apply for your programme by the application deadline.

Accept your Offer of Study

To confirm your enrolment you need to accept your Offer of Study, send your documentation, and get your student ID.

Sort your finances

Calculate your fees, and check if you are eligible for fees-free study, a student loan and/or allowance.

Save / Load

If you have already signed up, you'll see any previously saved progress.

What level of study are you interested in?

You're all done!

Now take a look at what's on during Orientation week. Get set up for study, tour the campus, and enjoy the events.
